item.title: ğŸ”§ Install & Update
item.description: ğŸ‘‰ If you wish to follow a Step-By-Step guide which show you how to send you first message via HTTP API please go to âš¡ Quick Start. You probably already have run the docker run command during âš¡ Quick Start guide: docker run -it --rm -p 3000:3000/tcp --name waha devlikeapro/waha â˜ï¸ The above command is good for testing and development purposes, but not for production. To make it production-ready, you need to configure few more parameters to make it secure, reliable, and easy to manage.

item.title: ğŸ“Š Dashboard
item.description: Dashboard is a UI to manage your WhatsApp sessions! Download the Dashboard Overview video . You can access Dashboard by running the project and opening http://localhost:3000/dashboard (or similar, but with /dashboard at the end). â„¹ï¸ Default username and password: waha/waha docker run -it -p 3000:3000/tcp devlikeapro/waha-plus #waha-plus Configuration # When running WAHA you can set the following environment variables to configure the dashboard: WAHA_DASHBOARD_ENABLED=true - enable or disable the dashboard, by default true.

item.title: ğŸ“š Swagger (OpenAPI)
item.description: Overview # The project provides HTTP API (REST), which is documented with OpenAPI specification and Swagger UI. Download the Swagger Overview video . You can see all available endpoints, request/response examples, and even execute them directly from the Swagger UI. Find the latest versions: Swagger documentation -> Postman -> OpenAPI specification -> You can find Swagger documentation on the following url after you install and started it: Swagger: http://localhost:3000. OpenAPI: http://localhost:3000/-json.

item.title: ğŸ“¤ Send messages
item.description: We consider that you’ve run docker container and authenticated the session with QR code. If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from âš¡ Quick Start. Features # WEBJS NOWEB GOWS POST /api/sendText âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendSeen âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ PUT /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId} âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ DELETE /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId} âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendImage âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendFile âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendVoice âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendVideo âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendButtons âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendPoll #189 âœ”ï¸ POST /api/forwardMessage âœ”ï¸

item.title: ğŸ“¥ Receive messages
item.description: We consider that you’ve run docker container and authenticated the session with QR code. If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from Quick Start â†’. You must use Webhooks to receive messages from WhatsApp to your application. Start a new session with configured message event in webhooks - call POST /api/sessions/ with the payload: { "name": "default", "config": { "webhooks": [ { "url": "https://webhook.site/11111111-1111-1111-1111-11111111", "events": [ "message" ] } ] } } After that WAHA sends events (see below) about new messages to an endpoint you provided.

item.title: ğŸ–¥ï¸ Sessions
item.description: Overview # Session represents a WhatsApp Account (Phone Number) connected to WAHA that you can use to send and receive messages. Session Lifecycle # Before you can ğŸ“¤ Send or ğŸ“¥ Receive messages , you need to Create a session (optionally, Start) and authenticate it using QR code or pairing code. Here’s Session Lifecycle State Diagram: Click to open full size. Session Status # Here’s the list of possible session.status values:

item.title: ğŸ†” Profile
item.description: You can manage your WhatsApp profile with the following API! Features # Here’s the list of features that are available by ğŸ­ Engines: WEBJS NOWEB GOWS Get Profile GET /api/{SESSION}/profile âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ Set Profile Name PUT /api/{SESSION}/profile/name âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ Set Profile Status (About) PUT /api/{SESSION}/profile/status âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ Set/Delete Profile Status Picture PUT /api/{SESSION}/profile/picture DELETE /api/{SESSION}/profile/picture â• â• â• â• - Available in â• WAHA Plus API # Get Profile # You can get your profile information with the following API call:

item.title: ğŸ”„ Webhooks
item.description: In order to notify your application about events in the WhatsApp API, you can use Webhooks and Websockets. ğŸ‘‰ See the list of all available events in the Events section. ğŸŒŸ You can observe Events in real-time using ğŸ“Š Dashboard - Event Monitor! Webhooks # Webhooks are a way for two different applications to communicate with each other in real-time. When a certain event happens in one application, it sends a message to another application through a webhook URL.

item.title: ğŸŒ Proxy
item.description: Overview # If you’re experiencing issues scanning QR codes in WhatsApp, especially with Indian ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ phone numbers, using a proxy located close to the phone number’s location may help resolve the problem. It affects both WEBJS and NOWEB engines. ğŸ‘‰ If proxy doesn’t help but the project works on YOUR local laptop - check Tunneling. Symptoms # You start a new session in WhatsApp. Scan the QR code. Experience a long loading time.

item.title: ğŸ“¶ Polls
item.description: Waiting for WEBJS engine to support it, and we’ll add it ASAP! Endpoints # See the list of engines that support the feature ->. Send poll # Use the endpoint to send a poll! POST /api/sendPoll The request body is pretty simple: { "session": "default", "chatId": "123123123@c.us", "poll": { "name": "How are you?", "options": [ "Awesome!", "Good!", "Not bad!" ], "multipleAnswers": false } } The response you get back: { "id": "true_321321321@c.
